body:
On my laptop (Fedora 24, Python 2.7.12), I'm seeing:

```
$ spack versions armadillo
==> Safe versions (already checksummed):
  7.200.2  7.200.1
==> Remote versions (not yet checksummed):
  7.500.0  7.400.4  7.400.3  7.400.2  7.400.1  7.300.1  7.300.0  7.100.4  7.100.3  6.700.7
```

But on my cluster (CentOS 6, Python 2.6.6), I'm seeing:

```
==> Warning: Got an error parsing HTML. Use Python 2.7.3 or newer for better HTML parsing.
  http://sourceforge.net/projects/arma/files
  HTMLParseError: malformed start tag, at line 1632, column 115
==> Safe versions (already checksummed):
  7.200.2  7.200.1
==> Remote versions (not yet checksummed):
  Found no versions for armadillo
```

Even when I add a Spack-built Python 2.7.12, I'm still not getting any results. These are both on the latest develop commit. Any ideas what could be going wrong?
title: Inconsistent behavior with spack versions/checksum
